meanings.definition: Emitting energy in the form of waves or particles
meanings.sent1: The warm sun felt radiated on my skin.
meanings.sent2: The radiated heat from the fire kept us warm.
meanings.sent3: The radiated glow of the fireflies lit up the night.
meanings.sent4: Her smile radiated happiness like a bright light.
meanings.sent5: The radiated energy from the sun made the plants grow.

meanings.definition: Spread out from a central point
meanings.sent1: The sound radiated from the speaker in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The smell of fresh bread radiated from the bakery.
meanings.sent3: Laughter radiated from the classroom, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Hope radiated from her words, filling the room with positivity.
meanings.sent5: The news of the victory radiated through the town, spreading joy.

meanings.definition: Displaying a glowing or bright light
meanings.sent1: The radiated stars shone brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The radiated moonlight illuminated the path ahead.
meanings.sent3: The radiated lanterns lit up the garden beautifully.
meanings.sent4: Her radiated smile brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The radiated fireworks painted the sky with colors.

meanings.definition: Projecting or sending out in all directions
meanings.sent1: The radiated sound filled the room with music.
meanings.sent2: The radiated scent of flowers perfumed the air.
meanings.sent3: His radiated enthusiasm was contagious to everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The radiated joy in her eyes was infectious.
meanings.sent5: The radiated energy of the crowd fueled the team to victory.
